definition: to put down/to leave behind/to throw or knock down/to abandon or discard
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: Feud before fall: Suns trip Lakers.
Last month's salmonella outbreak got over 1,500 people sick.
sentences.chinese: 上个月沙门氏菌大爆发撂倒了1500多人。

sentences.english: Take out a Japanese soldier lying in wait in the grass.
sentences.chinese: 把藏在草中旳日我自己撂倒。

sentences.english: The police officer in that car began returning fire and struck both men, taking them down.
sentences.chinese: 随后警车内警察开始回击，并将袭击分子撂倒。

sentences.english: Shinji saw a flash of something to the left of him, and then he was knocked to the ground roughly.
sentences.chinese: 真嗣感觉左边有东西一闪，随即被狠狠地撂倒在地。

sentences.english: Heaven can be overturned, my sisters all.
sentences.chinese: 天若有情天亦老，动我姐妹全撂倒。

sentences.english: Whenever you play a black spell, you may destroy target creature if it is tapped.
sentences.chinese: 放个黑白的咒语能直接撂倒对手非横置生物不？

sentences.english: Allows you to mow down your opponents.

definition: to hack to death/to kill with an ax
to run off rebuffed/to fend off/(to fight off and make sb) run off
to overturn/to overthrow/to strike down (an enemy)
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
to beat up/to break to pieces
